FuncDef:
The pnp default route command creates a plug-and-play (PNP) route.
By default, PnP routes are automatically created during PnP.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an IP address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the name of a VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
During PnP, a device automatically generates PnP routes. After device commissioning is complete, PnP is not needed any more. To delete the routes generated during PnP, run the undo pnp default route command. During ZTP, a device automatically generates PnP routes. After the device restarts, the configuration is downloaded. After the ZTP process ends, the device restarts. Before the restart, the device automatically deletes the PnP routes.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
